If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ ae_eq_comm`
`+ ae_eq_rfl`

`+ eLpNormEssSup_eq_iSup`
`+ essInf_count`

`+ eventuallyEq_comm`

`+ limsup_top`
`+ of_finite`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>
```

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I'll let someone with more familiarity with the measure theory library make the final decision here.

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by j-loreaux.
Please redo `maintainer-merge` afterwards.

Like so?

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
Removing my request for review here, since I don't know this part of the library well enough to comment.

Thanks!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10416848048/job/28849894407)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10416848048/job/28849894867)
Why this duplication? Could one be deprecated?
We have this duplication for every concrete reflexive relation, eg `le_refl`/`le_rfl`. I'm not sure this PR is the place to upturn such a widespread pattern and naming convention.
:-( This makes me really sad, but okay.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Essential supremum according to the counting measure
